text: [Music]
hello this is chef down from food wishes
calm with marinated Cornish game hen and
wood i marinate them in a simple creamy
spicy garlicky pepper marinade sort of a
cousin to the Cornell chicken so in the
blender I have a jalapeno and a habanero
all right take the seeds out of those of
course some mayonnaise some plain
vegetable oil sherry vinegar although
any vinegar will work lots of garlic and
salt we're gonna blend that up and we
are gonna have a basic wet rub and or
marinade for this tender young Cornish
game hen baby chickens are the same as
baby chickens I don't know maybe they
are a special breed
but anyway Cornish game hens every
supermarket has one brand so I would get
that one alright cut those in half you
can look at any of my chicken demos to
see how to do that alright so I'm going
to pour over the marinade we're gonna
let that go for three hours refrigerate
of course and we're ready to grill so
before i grill I'm gonna kind of give it
a little quick wipe with the tongs a
little bit of marinade on there's good
but you don't want it stopped and wet
and if you want a little more salt on
the skin side here not a bad idea and
then on to a medium hot grill so what I
did is I marked those turn them over and
I went most of the way with the lid down
if you want you can certainly keep some
of that excess marinade from the bag and
brush it on throughout the cooking
process you can just do stuff like that
on your own you don't even have to have
me tell you okay so this went for about
45 minutes so I'm gonna give that as an
estimate time but you know you got to
kind of play it by ear once they were
almost cooked I had a beautiful brown
crispy skin I move those off direct heat
and just finished on that last 10
minutes kind of off to the side and
there you go all right I want to sound
immodest but that's some pretty damn
nice skin there alright any time you get
that basic oil vinegar marinade going
you know it's gonna be tasty the peppers
brought a little heat
alright the creaminess from the
mayonnaise sort of the same deal is with
the Cornell chicken gave it a nice
richness and a nice
and you know garlic and salt don't hurt
it's one of these recipes where you're
not going to taste really any of the
single components it's just gonna taste
like moist flavorful chicken so it's not
gonna be like a pepper chicken or a
vinegar chicken or garlic chicken it's
gonna be delicious chicken which is what
we're after now you could just tear into
those just like that beautiful with some
fresh lemon of fresh lime squeezed over
I enjoyed it with a mango salsa that
Michelle made little sweet spicy mango
salsa perfect with this off to the side
there you see some fried butter beans
and a little kind of weird in the
picture but nice crispy fried butter
beans anyway go to the site all the
ingredients are there and as always
enjoy
you
